summary: Good work! 🌟 Here are some general recommendations for improving your Python code.

params.bad_code:
Instead of: 
```python
print("Hello")  # CRLF (\r\n)
print("world")  # End-of-file (EOF)
# [missing-final-newline]

print("Hello")  # LF (\n)
print("world")  # End-of-file (EOF)
# [missing-final-newline]

```
params.good_code:
Try: 
```python
print("Hello")  # CRLF (\r\n)
print("world")  # CRLF (\r\n)
# End-of-file (EOF)

print("Hello")  # LF (\n)
print("world")  # LF (\n)
# End-of-file (EOF)
```
params.details:
The POSIX standard defines a line as:

:   \"A sequence of zero or more non- \<newline\> characters plus a
    terminating \<newline\> character.\"

params.bad_code:
Instead of: 
```python
import sys  # [missing-module-docstring]


def print_python_version():
    print(sys.version)
```
params.good_code:
Try: 
```python
"""Module providing a function printing python version."""

import sys


def print_python_version():
    print(sys.version)
```
